cards.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When in battle, may target one opponent's character present. Draw destiny. Target 'choked' (lost) if destiny > ability. Immune to attrition < 5.
cards.lore: Formerly Anakin Skywalker, Jedi Knight. Became Darth Vader. Ordered by Emperor Palpatine to deal with Luke Skywalker, but bargained for his son's life instead.
cards.name: Darth Vader, Dark Lord Of The Sith

cards.gametext: Power +1 when at same site as Admiral Ozzel. Adds 1 to power of each Imperial at same Hoth site. Adds 3 to power of any combat vehicle he pilots. On Blizzard 1, also adds 1 to armor and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
cards.lore: General Maximillian Veers is the model of Imperial Army officer. Cunning, loyal and ruthlessly efficient \b leader\b0. In charge of the ground assault troops in Vader's forces.
cards.name: General Veers

cards.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When with Vader in a battle, once per battle may cancel one opponent's destiny just drawn.
cards.lore: \b Leader\b0. Governor of Outer Rim Territories. Commanded Death Star. Helped disband Imperial Senate. Defined doctrine of rule by fear. Plotted to use Death Star against Emperor.
cards.name: Grand Moff Tarkin

cards.gametext: Deploy -2 at Tatooine or Nal Hutta. To use his landspeed requires +2 Force. May escort a captive. While at Audience Chamber, adds 1 to forfeit of all your other aliens and allows you to activate 1 Force for whenever you Force drain with an alien. Immune to attrition < 4.
cards.lore: Jabba Desilijic Tiure. Male heir to Zorba the Hutt. \b Gangster\b0. \b Leader\b0  of one of the largest criminal organizations in the galaxy. Over six hundred years old.
cards.name: Jabba The Hutt

cards.gametext: May add 6 pilots, 8 passengers, 2 vehicles and 4 TIEs. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 2.
cards.lore: Supported the devastating subjugation of Ralltiir. While under the command of Darth Vader, chased and captured the traitor Princess Leia Organa aboard the consular ship \ul Tantive IV\ul0.
cards.name: Devastator

cards.gametext: May add unlimited pilots, passengers, vehicles and starfighters. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilots provide total ability of 3. Immune to attrition < 12.
cards.lore: Flagship of Death Squadron. Over eight kilometers long. Carries 38,000 troops. Can conquer entire star systems by sheer intimidation and terror. Lord Vader's personal command ship.
cards.name: Executor

cards.gametext: May add 1 pilot (must be a bounty hunter) and 3 passengers. May deploy with a pilot as a 'react'. Immune to attrition < 5 if Boba Fett piloting. Has ship-docking capability.
cards.lore: Originally designed as a planetary defense craft. Uses restricted jamming technology, allowing it to appear out of nowhere. Contains many hidden armaments.
cards.name: Slave I

cards.gametext: May add 1 pilot. If Vader is pilot, Custom TIE is immune to attrition < 4.
cards.lore: TIE advanced x1 prototype. First of a limited production run leading to the development of the TIE Interceptor. At Vader's insistence a hyperdrive was installed.
cards.name: Vader's Custom TIE

cards.gametext: Deploy on Vader. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
cards.lore: Custom-built by Darth Vader. After the Clone Wars, he wielded this weapon while hunting down the last of the Jedi. Cuts through almost anything except another lightsaber blade.
cards.name: Vader's Lightsaber

cards.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. When in a duel, adds 2 to your total. Once per turn, if a battle just ended, may 'revive' (place here from Lost Pile) your character forfeited from same site this turn. Immune to attrition < 5.
cards.lore: Served Bail Organa during the Clone Wars. Saved Anakin's lightsaber until he was able to give it to Luke. Hasn't gone by the name Obi-Wan for a long time.
cards.name: Ben Kenobi

cards.gametext: Total power at same site is +2 for each of your droid/Rebel pairs present, including C-3PO. R2-D2 is forfeit +2 when present.
cards.lore: Cybot Galactica 3PO human-cyborg relations droid. Fluent in over six million forms of communication. 112 years old. Has never been memory-wiped...as far as he knows.
cards.name: C-3PO (See-Threepio)

cards.gametext: Deploys only on \ul Falcon\ul0, Hoth or Cloud City. Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting \ul Falcon\ul0, adds one battle destiny and 2 to maneuver. Once during each battle, may use 2 Force to cancel one opponent's destiny just drawn and cause a re-draw.
cards.lore: \b Smuggler\b0  and scoundrel. His piloting abilities have become legend in the Rebellion. Intends to leave the Alliance to pay off Jabba the Hutt.
cards.name: Captain Han Solo

cards.gametext: Power +1 at same location as Han. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting \ul Falcon\ul0, also adds 1 to maneuver. Your vehicles, starships, and droids at same site that are 'hit' and about to be lost go to Used Pile instead.
cards.lore: Wookiee \b smuggler\b0  from Kashyyyk. Over 200 years old. Top-notch mechanic and pilot. Jabba has large bounty on this "walking carpet." Friends call him Chewie ... or Fuzzball.
cards.name: Chewbacca

cards.gametext: Once during battle, may use 1 Force to cancel and re-draw your just drawn destiny. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting \ul Falcon\ul0, also adds 2 to maneuver and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
cards.lore: \b Smuggler\b0, \b gambler\b0  and "freelance law-bender." Crafty Corellian pirate. Rebel hero. Owns \ul Millennium Falcon\ul0. Co-pilot Chewbacca promised him "life-debt." Has bounty on head.
cards.name: Han Solo

cards.gametext: Adds 1 to power of each Rebel present with her at a Death Star site. 'Diplomatic' immunity to attrition < 2.
cards.lore: Strong-willed princess from Alderaan. Youngest Imperial Senator ever. Used diplomatic immunity to \b spy\b0  for Rebels. Led relief effort on Ralltiir. Natural \b leader\b0.
cards.name: Leia Organa

cards.gametext: When a battle was just initiated where present, may use 1 Force to choose one opponent's character of ability = 1 present to move away (for free), or that character is lost. Immune to attrition < 5.
cards.lore: Jedi Knight. Trained by Yoda. Friend of Bail Organa. General Kenobi became a hero of the Old Republic during the Clone Wars. Mentor of Anakin and Luke Skywalker.
cards.name: Obi-Wan Kenobi

cards.gametext: * Deploys free as an escorted captive of Jabba, or a bounty hunter (you may not initiate battle there on same turn). While a captive, opponent's unique (*) aliens at same site are forfeit -2. If released, retrieve 5 Force. Immune to attrition < 3.
cards.lore: Captured by Jabba. Princess Leia provided a distraction for his henchbeings. Waiting for the first chance to escape. Really made Jabba's tail wiggle.
cards.name: Princess Leia Organa

cards.gametext: While aboard any starfighter, adds 2 to power, maneuver and hyperspeed (3 on Red 5). If at a Scomp link when opponent draws destiny of: 1-3, you may activate one Force; 4-6, you may draw top card from Reserve Deck.
cards.lore: Fiesty. Loyal. Heroic. Insecure. Rebel \b spy\b0. Excels at trouble. Incorrigible counterpart of a mindless philosopher. Has picked up a slight flutter. A bit eccentric.
cards.name: R2-D2 (Artoo-Detoo)

cards.gametext: Deploys only on Dagobah or Cloud City. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Once per game, during your deploy phase, a lightsaber may deploy on Luke (for free) from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 4.
cards.lore: Luke Skywalker. Son of Anakin. Seeker of Yoda. Levitator of rocks. Ignorer of advice. Incapable of impossible. Reckless is he.
cards.name: Son Of Skywalker

cards.gametext: Deploy on your starfighter. During any control phase, may target one opponent's capital starship present. Starfighter attaches to target (automatically moves with target and is 'concealed'). May detach at any time (even as target begins to move).
cards.lore: Special modification for starfighters. Size may vary depending on mass of starship. Allows a stable connection to a spacedock, uneven terrain or even another starship.
cards.name: Landing Claw

cards.gametext: May add 2 pilots and 2 passengers. Immune to attrition < 5 if Han, Chewie or Lando piloting. Has ship-docking capability.
cards.lore: Modified YT-1300 freighter. Owned by Lando Calrissian until won by Han in a sabacc game. 26.7 meters long. "She may not look like much, but she's got it where it counts."
cards.name: Millennium Falcon

cards.characteristics: \b Black Sun agent\b0, \b bounty hunter\b0, \b information broker\b0, \b thief\b0
cards.gametext: Total power at same site is +1 for each of your alien/droid pairs present. Once during each battle, if present with Zuckuss, may use 1 Force to search any Used Pile and relocate one character there to the lost pile. May initiate battle and be battled.
cards.lore: \b Information broker\b0. \b Thief\b0. Overrode and reprogrammed its own self-governing software. Convinced Jabba the Hutt to upgrade its armor and weaponry. Became a \b bounty hunter\b0.
cards.name: 4-LOM

cards.gametext: Adds 2 to the power of anything he pilots. Subtracts 1 from deploy cost of each of your capital starships at same system. Lost if Vader on table and opponent 'reacts' to same location as Ozzel.
cards.lore: \b Leader\b0  of the Emperor's Death Squadron assigned to hunt down and crush the Rebellion. As clumsy as he is stupid. Has just failed Darth Vader for the next-to-last time.
cards.name: Admiral Ozzel

cards.gametext: At the start of a battle, may use 1 Force to 'mindscan' one opponent's non-droid character of lesser ability present; adds that character's power and game text to his own for remainder of battle. Immune to attrition < 3.
cards.lore: Mysterious \b bounty hunter\b0  of an unknown species. Rumored to be somewhat telepathic. Infrequent member of Jabba's court. Plotting to kill Jabba.
cards.name: Bane Malar

cards.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. Opponent's characters of ability < 4 may not move from same site as Bib to a Jabba's Palace site. When at a Jabba's Palace site, each of your Gamorreans and Niktos may deploy as a 'react' to any Jabba's Palace site.
cards.lore: Twi'lek \b leader\b0  and majordomo of Jabba's palace. Succeeded Jabba's last majordomo, Naroon Cuthus. Plotting to kill Jabba.
cards.name: Bib Fortuna

cards.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting \ul Hound's Tooth\ul0, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. Adds 1 to attrition against opponent in battles at same site. May reduce Chewie's forfeit to zero here.
cards.lore: Male Trandoshan \b bounty hunter\b0. Strong but clumsy. Extremely proud and arrogant. Suffered a humiliating defeat at the hands of Chewbacca and his partner Han Solo.
cards.name: Bossk

cards.characteristics: \b Black Sun agent\b0, \b bounty hunter\b0, \b Corellian\b0, \b assassin\b0
cards.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Power +1 for each opponent's character present. While present, may reduce Han's forfeit to zero here.
cards.lore: Corellian \b bounty hunter\b0. Assassin trained by the Empire. Has reflex-enhancing cyber implants. Gravely injured during a swoop race in the crystal swamp of Agrilat. Blames Han Solo.
cards.name: Dengar

cards.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Black 3, also adds 1 to maneuver and may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
cards.lore: Pilot DS-61-3. Vader's right wingman. Flies Black 3. Reputation for ferocity in combat. Corellian pilot with excellent skills. Nicknamed 'Backstabber.'
cards.name: DS-61-3

cards.characteristics: \b Black Sun agent\b0, \b bounty hunter\b0, \b Rodian\b0
cards.gametext: During opponent's control phase, may 'threaten' one smuggler at same site. Opponent may use all Force Pile cards to cancel threat, allowing you to activate same amount. Otherwise, draw destiny. If destiny + Greedo's ability > 6, smuggler lost.
cards.lore: Male Rodian \b bounty hunter\b0. Sent by Jabba to capture Han. Arrogant, overconfident and not too bright. Trained by bounty hunters Nataz and Goa, who betrayed him to Thuku.
cards.name: Greedo

cards.characteristics: \b Black Sun agent\b0, \b bounty hunter\b0, assassin
cards.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. May 'assassinate' any character at same site hit by IG-88 (victim is immediately lost). May use two different weapons. May initiate battle and be battled. Immune to Restraining Bolt and purchase.
cards.lore: \b Bounty hunter\b0. Went berserk upon activation. Murdered all designers at Holowan Mechanicals. IG-88's outstanding "dismantle on sight" warrant ignored by Darth Vader.
cards.name: IG-88

cards.gametext: When at Detention Block Corridor, adds X to your Force drains there, where X = number of captives here. Immune to Restraining Bolt.
cards.lore: Floating prisoner interrogation droid. Uses probes and needles to dispense truth drugs and perform 'surgery.' Sensors determine subject's pain threshold and truthfulness.
cards.name: IT-O (Eyetee-Oh)

cards.gametext: To use his landspeed requires +1 Force. Your aliens are deploy -1 to same location. While at Audience Chamber, adds 2 to forfeit of all your non-unique aliens and makes Scum and Villainy immune to Alter. Immune to attrition < 4.
cards.lore: \b Gangster\b0. \b Leader\b0. Infamous Hutt crime lord. Operates his vast empire from an ancient monastery on Tatooine. Uses mercenary pilots to smuggle spice and other contraband.
cards.name: Jabba

cards.gametext: Opponent may initiate battle at same site for free. At same or adjacent site, whenever an opponent draws a card for battle destiny, if it is: Even, opponent must use 1 Force (if possible); Odd, destiny card is lost. (AH-hahahahaha!)
cards.lore: Male Kowakian. Prankster. Humiliates others for Jabba's amusement. His life depends on making Jabba laugh at least once per day.
cards.name: Salacious Crumb

cards.gametext: Twice during each of your control phases, may use 2 Force to draw 2 destiny for 2 chances at a destiny = 2. If successful, may steal or destroy up to 2 weapons or 2 devices present.
cards.lore: Twins. \b Thieves\b0. Con artists. \b Spies\b0. Swindlers. Double agents. Brea and Senni use their natural charm to sway the unwary on the fringe of society.
cards.name: Tonnika Sisters

cards.gametext: Deploy on opponent's side as an Undercover spy (except that if present during a battle at a site, adds its power to Light Side). If spy's "cover is broken," the above "game text" is canceled and Light Side may use as if stolen.
cards.lore: This protocol droid served in the House of Alderaan's Diplomatic Corps. Imperials altered its programming for espionage, making the droid an unwitting \b spy\b0  for the Empire.
cards.name: U-3PO (Yoo-Threepio)

cards.characteristics: \b Black Sun agent\b0, \b bounty hunter\b0, \b scout\b0
cards.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. May move for free as 'react.' Once during each battle, may use 1 Force to cause one alien of ability < 3 at same site to be forfeit = 0 for remainder of turn. Immune to attrition < 3.
cards.lore: Male Gand. Practitioner of ancient religious findsman vocation. \b Bounty hunter\b0  and \b scout\b0. Gains surprisingly accurate information through mystical visions during meditation.
cards.name: Zuckuss

cards.gametext: * Ferocity = 8 + destiny. Habitat: Rancor Pit and exterior planet sites. Deploys only to the Rancor Pit or to where Malakili is the only character. Moves towards another Rancor whenever possible.
cards.lore: Indigenous to Dathomir, but found on several dozen worlds throughout the galaxy. Vicious predator. Sometimes kept as pets by eccentrics and crime lords.
cards.name: Rancor

cards.gametext: * Ferocity = 3 + destiny. Habitat: Hoth sites. Deploy only to Wampa Cave or unoccupied marker site. Defeated characters are eaten or relocated to Wampa Cave (opponent of victim chooses).
cards.lore: Sly, carnivorous beast which stalks the snow-packed tundra. Wampas frequently drag their prey to an ice cave for storage. They always prefer to devour their victims alive.
cards.name: Wampa

cards.gametext: Deploy on any site. 'Expands' your "game text" for that site to add to your "game text" at the adjacent sites.
cards.lore: The Emperor disbanded the Imperial Senate "for the duration of the emergency," seizing absolute power. He planned to extend rule by terrorizing planets into submission.
cards.name: Expand The Empire

cards.gametext: Deploy on any location to add one (Dark Side Force icon) icon and one (Light Side Force icon) icon.
cards.lore: "A location is affected by the history of the events which occur there. The Force "...binds the galaxy together" and has an ebb and flow."
cards.name: Presence Of The Force

cards.gametext: Lose 2 Force to deploy on \ul Executor\ul0: Holotheatre or Death Star: Conference Room. At the end of each player's turn, each player must lose 1 Force. Effect canceled if opponent controls this site. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: Palpatine's \b hologram\b0. Imposing. Ominous. Intimidating. Instrument for the evil Emperor's sinister reach across the galaxy. Used on a secret frequency of the Imperial HoloNet.
cards.name: Visage Of The Emperor

cards.gametext: During your control phase, fire Superlaser as follows: \par \b Name the System:\b0  Use X Force to target a planet system Death Star is orbiting. \par \b You May Fire When Ready:\b0  Draw Destiny. \par \b Stand By:\b0  If (destiny +Y -Z) > 8, target system is "blown away" and this card is lost. Otherwise, this card is used and one Death Star Gunner on table is lost (your choice). \par X = total sites at target. \par Y = total Death Star sites where opponent has no presence. \par Z = opponent's choice of X or total sites at one Rebel Base (Yavin 4 or Hoth).
cards.name: Commence Primary Ignition

cards.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. The Circle Is Now Complete or Vader's Obsession may be played to initiate an epic duel as follows: If Vader is present with specified target, each player draws two destiny (add 1 to each destiny draw if using a lightsaber). Add character's ability.\par If \b Vader\b0  loses, place him out of play. You lose 6 Force (9 if dueling Luke).\par If \b Obi-Wan\b0  loses, place him out of play. Opponent loses 9 Force.\par If \b Luke\b0  loses, opponent must choose: Cross Luke to the Dark Side and lose X Force, where X = Luke's ability. OR Lose Luke and lose triple X Force.
cards.name: Epic Duel

cards.gametext: Relocate a card from the top of any Deck or Pile to the bottom (without looking). OR If you have a droid at a Scomp link on Cloud City, cancel Into The Ventilation Shaft, Lefty. OR Use 3 Force to cause a character at Weather vane to be lost.
cards.lore: Luke got the shaft.
cards.name: Slip Sliding Away

cards.gametext: If Vader and Obi-Wan are present at same site, use 1 Force to initiate a duel between them. Compare their power, and add 2 if that character is armed with a lightsaber. Loser (lowest total) of duel is placed out of play.
cards.lore: Vader and Obi-Wan Kenobi fought a final lightsaber duel near Hangar Bay 327 on the Death Star. "When I left you I was but the learner; now I am the master."
cards.name: The Circle Is Now Complete

cards.gametext: May add 6 pilots, 8 passengers, 2 vehicles, and 4 TIEs. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Subtract 2 from asteroid destiny draws targeting \ul Avenger\ul0.
cards.lore: Key starship used to subjugate Outer Rim worlds. Reassigned to Death Squadron under the command of Captain Needa. Communications ship at the Battle of Endor.
cards.name: Avenger

cards.gametext: May add 1 pilot.
cards.lore: TIE/ln assigned to pilot DS-61-2. Has 27 'flames' on cockpit, one for each Rebel kill. Control yoke has a holo of Mithels' young son, Rejili.
cards.name: Black 2

cards.gametext: May add 6 passengers and 1 vehicle. Permanent pilot is (*]Bossk, who provides ability of 2, adds 2 to power and adds one battle destiny. Deploys and moves like a starfighter. Has ship-docking capability.
cards.lore: Bossk once said of his ship, "Greeezeg uut nikek!"
cards.name: Bossk In Hound's Tooth

cards.gametext: May add 6 pilots, 8 passengers, 2 vehicles and 4 TIEs. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Just after initiating battle against \ul Falcon\ul0, may peek at opponent's hand.
cards.lore: One of the Imperial cruisers that chased the \ul Millennium Falcon\ul0  from Tatooine. It scanned the \ul Falcon\ul0  just before Han punched his starship to lightspeed.
cards.name: Conquest

cards.gametext: Deploy -2 to same system as \ul Executor\ul0. May add 6 pilots, 8 passengers, 2 vehicles and 4 TIEs. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Immune to attrition < 4.
cards.lore: Vader's infamous Death Squadron, which blockaded the fleeing Rebels at the Battle of Hoth, boasts the finest captains of the Imperial fleet - and Ozzel.
cards.name: Death Squadron Star Destroyer

cards.gametext: May add 1 pilot (must be a smuggler or bounty hunter) and 2 passengers. Maneuver +3 and immune to attrition < 3 if IG-88 piloting. Ion Cannon may deploy aboard.
cards.lore: IG-88's assault starfighter. Custom designed. Boasts a Kuat Galaxy-15 engine from a Nebulon-B frigate. Heavy ion cannon often used to disable starships before boarding.
cards.name: IG-2000

cards.gametext: May add 2 pilots (one must be a smuggler or bounty hunter) and 3 passengers. Immune to attrition < 3 if Zuckuss piloting. Has ship-docking capability.
cards.lore: Commissioned by a group of gand venture capitalists headed by Zuckuss. Manufactured by Byblos Drive Yards. Uses repulsor lift technology developed for combat cloud cars.
cards.name: Mist Hunter

cards.gametext: Deploy -1 and power +3 at any cloud sector. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 2.
cards.lore: TIE fighter modified for upper atmosphere maneuvers. Pilot nicknamed "Winged Gundark" due to the number of kills earned in high-altitude battles.
cards.name: Obsidian 7

cards.gametext: Deploy -1 and power +3 at any cloud sector. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.
cards.lore: Modified TIE fighter. Used most often to pursue raiders attempting to take refuge in the upper atmosphere of nearby planets. Pilot previously stationed aboard \ul Devastator\ul0.
cards.name: Obsidian 8

cards.gametext: May add 1 pilot (must be a smuggler or bounty hunter) and 1 passenger. Immune to attrition < 3 if Dengar piloting. Deploy -3 when deploying with Dengar. Boosted TIE Cannon may deploy aboard.
cards.lore: Old Corellian Engineering Corporation starfighter. Has outdated Class Three hyperdrive, but high sublight speed capability. Easy to maintain. Owned by Dengar.
cards.name: Punishing One

cards.gametext: May add 6 pilots, 8 passengers, 2 vehicles and 4 TIEs. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Probe droids deploy free to sites related to same system.
cards.lore: Originally assigned to search the Outer Rim for new worlds to subjugate. Launched the probe droid that found Echo Base. Later reassigned to Death Squadron.
cards.name: Stalker

cards.gametext: May add 6 pilots, 8 passengers, 2 vehicles and 4 TIEs. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. When using Tractor Beam, adds 1 to destiny draw.
cards.lore: Assigned to Admiral Ozzel's Death Squadron. Attempted to capture Rebel starships fleeing the Hoth system.
cards.name: Tyrant

cards.gametext: May add 6 pilots, 8 passengers, 1 vehicle and 6 TIEs. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Your TIE/lns are forfeit +2 at same location. Power +2 at Nal Hutta.
cards.lore: Part of Darth Vader's Death Squadron. Support vessel for the fleet's starfighters. Cargo areas converted into hangar space for additional TIE fighters.
cards.name: Vengeance

cards.gametext: May add 2 pilots and 8 passengers. Immune to attrition < 4. Landspeed may not be increased. When using AT-AT Cannon to Target The Main Generator, adds 1 to total.
cards.lore: General Veers' AT-AT. \b Enclosed\b0. Equipped with highly sophisticated communications gear. Employs an experimental targeting system.
cards.name: Blizzard 1

cards.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 8 passengers. Immune to attrition < 4. Landspeed may not be increased. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2.
cards.lore: AT-AT commanded by the treacherous General Nevar before he was assassinated. Fortified with an extra layer of armor by the paranoid general. \b Enclosed\b0.
cards.name: Blizzard 2

cards.gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. May move as a 'react.' Power +1 at any Hoth site. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1.
cards.lore: \b Enclosed\b0  All Terrain Scout Transport (AT-ST). Provides flanking support to the AT-ATs of Blizzard Force. Modified for cold weather combat.
cards.name: Blizzard Scout 1

cards.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine; you may immediately deploy Passenger Deck from your Reserve Deck and reshuffle. May add 1 driver and 7 passengers. Your aliens deploy -1 aboard.
cards.lore: Ubrikkian sail barge. Custom built for Jabba with an armored hull and weaponry. Top speed of 100 kph. Used by the Hutt crimelord on his many trips to Mos Eisley.
cards.name: Jabba's Sail Barge

cards.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on Boba Fett, or 3 on your other bounty hunter. May deploy as a 'react.' May target a character, creature or vehicle using 2 Force. Draw destiny. Add 1 if targeting a vehicle. Target hit if total destiny > defense value. May fire repeatedly for 1 Force each time.
cards.lore: Sawed off BlasTech EE-3 blaster rifle. Although its barrel is a few centimeters under the legal limit, no one has lived to file an official complaint.
cards.name: Boba Fett's Blaster Rifle

cards.gametext: Deploy on Death Star system at parsec 0. May target a capital starship at Death Star system, or at a system it orbits, using 4 Force. Draw two destiny. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
cards.lore: The Death Star has more firepower than the combined might of the entire Imperial fleet. Enormous generators power the devastating planet-destroying weapon.
cards.name: Superlaser

cards.gametext: Once per turn, your non-droid character lost from same site may go to your Used Pile rather than your Lost Pile. Subtracts 2 from X on your Bacta Tank.
cards.lore: Made by Genetech. Unusually independent for a droid. Forced to serve a Moff on Firro, but was liberated by Tiree. Now dedicated to serving the Alliance.
cards.name: 2-1B (Too-Onebee)

cards.gametext: During each of your control phases, may take one Hero Of A Thousand Devices or A Gift into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. If at a battleground site with C-3PO, may subtract 1 from each opponent's battle destiny at same and related sites.
cards.lore: Counterpart to C-3PO. \b Spy\b0. Obstinate, headstrong and always full of surprises. R2-D2 was an integral part of Luke Skywalker's rescue plans.
cards.name: Artoo

cards.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Red 3, also adds 1 to maneuver and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
cards.lore: Piloted Red 3 at Battle of Yavin. Childhood friend of Luke. Led mutiny on \ul Rand Ecliptic\ul0  and theft of \ul Ecliptic\ul0  from shipyards on Bestine. \ul Ecliptic\ul0  Evaders emblem on helmet.
cards.name: Biggs Darklighter

cards.gametext: * Power = Sqrt(3(X-Y) +2 (A-B)+pi) (minimum power=1). X = Dark Side hand cards; Y = Light Side hand cards; A = total number of (Dark Side Force icon) icons in play; B = total number of (Light Side Force icon) icons in play; pi=3.141592653589793238462643383...
cards.lore: BoShek nicknamed this male Siniteen 'Brainiac' due to his ability to calculate hyperspace coordinates in his head. "He's the brains, sweetheart!"
cards.name: Brainiac

cards.gametext: Deploys only on Hoth. Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Rogue 1, also adds 2 to maneuver. Immune to attrition < 3. Adds 1 to forfeit of each other Rogue Squadron pilot or gunner at same Hoth site.
cards.lore: Hero of Yavin. Promoted to Commander in his third year of military training with the Alliance. Squadron flight \b leader\b0  at Echo Base during the Battle of Hoth.
cards.name: Commander Luke Skywalker

cards.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Gold 1, also adds 1 to maneuver and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. Adds 1 to forfeit of each other Gold Squadron pilot at same location.
cards.lore: Jon 'Dutch' Vander. Gold Squadron \b leader\b0  at Battle of Yavin. Prefers Y-wing fighters. Previously led squadron at Renforra Base. Emblem of Specter Squadron on his helmet.
cards.name: Dutch

cards.gametext: During your control phase, may cause opponent to reveal entire hand by using X Force, where X = number of cards in opponent's hand. All unique (*) male Imperials or unique (*) male aliens there are placed in opponent's Used Pile.
cards.lore: Female Twi'lek \b musician\b0. Became a dancer to live a life of luxury. Has worked for Jabba for only two days. Desperate to escape.
cards.name: Oola

cards.gametext: Deploys only on Hoth or Cloud City. Adds 1 to power of anything she pilots. May deploy (on Hoth or Cloud City) or move as a 'react' to same site as Han or Luke. Immune to attrition < 3.
cards.lore: Prominent \b leader\b0  in the struggling Alliance. Former member of the Imperial Senate. Beginning to discover her true heritage. Likes scoundrels.
cards.name: Princess Leia

cards.gametext: While at a Rebel Base location, subtracts 1 from opponent's Force drains at related locations. Once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one Leia Of Alderaan, Reflection or leader of ability < 3 to same location from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
cards.lore: Adopted by Bail Organa. Former senator of Alderaan. Natural \b leader\b0. Helped steal the Death Star plans. A key figure in the Rebel Alliance.
cards.name: Princess Organa

cards.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Red 1, also adds 1 to maneuver and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. Adds 1 to forfeit of each other Red Squadron pilot at same location.
cards.lore: X-wing pilot Garven Dreis. Led Red Squadron at the Battle of Yavin, and fired an unsuccessful shot at the Death Star thermal exhaust port. Served at Dantooine Rebel base.
cards.name: Red Leader

cards.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Once per game, Undercover may deploy on Tamtel from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While at a site you control, Rebels are immune to None Shall Pass at that site.
cards.lore: \b Gambler\b0. Lando Calrissian posed as a guard for Jabba in order to \b spy\b0  on the Hutt. Feared that he would be recognized by some of Jabba's companions.
cards.name: Tamtel Skreej

cards.gametext: Deploys only as an Undercover spy at same site as an Imperial. While Undercover, Imperials are deploy +1 at related sites. May voluntarily "break cover" only during your move phase by using 3 Force. Captured if "cover broken" by opponent.
cards.lore: Corellian \b smuggler\b0. \b Spy\b0. Han stole the armor and identity of an enemy soldier that boarded the \ul Millennium Falcon\ul0. Bluffed his way into the detention area.
cards.name: TK-422

cards.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Red 2, also adds 2 to maneuver and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. May use 1 Force to take one Corellian Slip into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
cards.lore: Highly decorated Corellian. Piloted Red 2 at the Battle of Yavin. A wealthy orphan, he bought a freighter with his inheritance. First joined the Alliance as weapons \b smuggler\b0.
cards.name: Wedge Antilles

cards.gametext: Deploy on Dagobah I must, but move elsewhere I may, yes. When the mentor, 1 to training destiny I add. Where present am I, battles and attacks happen not unless present a Dark Side character of ability > 3 there is. To attrition, immune am I.
cards.lore: Help you I can, yes. For 800 years have I trained Jedi. Judge me by my size do you? Mm? And well you should not! For my ally is the Force... and a powerful ally it is.
cards.name: Yoda

cards.gametext: Deploy on Coruscant system if you occupy at least two Coruscant battleground sites. During each of your control phases, retrieve 1 Force for each Coruscant battleground site you occupy. Canceled if opponent controls this system. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: Despite Imperial propaganda, the citizens of Coruscant very much wish for the collapse of the Empire.
cards.name: Coruscant Celebration

cards.gametext: Deploy on any Death Star site (except docking bay). Target one of your droids (not on Death Star). When target reaches Utinni Effect, 'steal' plans. If target then moves to any Yavin 4 site, draw 3 destiny. Retrieve that much lost Force. Lose Utinni Effect.
cards.lore: "What's so important? What's he carrying?" "The technical readouts of that battle station. I only hope that when the data is analyzed, a weakness can be found."
cards.name: Death Star Plans

cards.gametext: Deploy on one of the following systems: Rendezvous Point, Hoth, Yavin 4, Alderaan, or Sullust. Your starships deploy -2 and your pilots deploy -1 here. When battling here, you may add one battle destiny. Effect canceled if opponent controls this system. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: After pursuit, asteroids, a slug, Jedi training, capture, torture, escape, a duel, losing Han and losing a hand, Luke and Leia finally made it to the Alliance's rendezvous point.
cards.name: Haven

cards.gametext: Deploy on your character with ability > 2 and a lightsaber. That character is power +3 in battles or may add 1 to Force drain where present. Effect is lost if character loses lightsaber.
cards.lore: A Jedi learns not only to wield a lightsaber, but how to channel the Force to increase skill and control the lightsaber's damage.
cards.name: Lightsaber Proficiency

cards.gametext: Deploy on an exterior site. Target an opponent's combat vehicle at a related site. Target's power and forfeit = 0. When target reaches Utinni Effect, target draws one destiny. Utinni Effect canceled if destiny > 2. Otherwise, draw again next move phase, etc.
cards.lore: The massive war machines of the Empire require tremendous effort to maintain combat readiness.
cards.name: Mechanical Failure

cards.gametext: Deploy on Leia. Once during each of your control phases, you may use 3 Force to retrieve 1 Force. Also, when an apprentice, adds 1 to her training destiny.
cards.lore: It was hard to imagine the enormous losses the Alliance suffered during the Battle of Hoth. Leia contemplated what she could do to help the Rebellion recover.
cards.name: Reflection

cards.gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on any location. Rotate the location so that icons and game texts switch direction. (If Expand the Empire present, it also switches.) If Revolution later canceled, location rotates back again.
cards.lore: Spies and informants gave Rebels vital data to plan strategic turnabouts, create local insurgencies, and hamper Imperial activities.
cards.name: Revolution

cards.gametext: Deploy on Vader. He is power +2, but neither adds 1 to battle destiny nor allows Tarkin to cancel destiny. Opponent loses 2 Force at end of each of opponent's turns in which Vader did not battle and you had a character of ability > 3 on table. (Immune to Alter.)
cards.lore: The rage of the Dark Lord.
cards.name: Uncontrollable Fury

cards.gametext: Deploy on Emperor or any system. Target one character whose lore uses the word 'Emperor.' Target cannot use ability to draw battle destiny and is excluded from being the "highest-ability character." Utinni Effect canceled when reached by target.
cards.lore: Reaching across the galaxy, the Emperor uses his vast powers to require immediate submission and obedience. His minions frequently find this inconvenient.
cards.name: What Is Thy Bidding, My Master?

cards.gametext: Deploy on Death Star: Trench. \par During your move phase, you may make an Attack Run as follows: \par \b Enter Trench:\b0  Move up to 3 of your starfighters into trench (for free). Dark Side may immediately follow with up to 3 TIEs (for free). \par \b Provide Cover:\b0  Identify your lead starfighter (Proton Torpedoes* required) and wingmen (if any). Turbolaser Batteries and TIEs with weapons may now target your starfighters (wingmen first, then lead if no wingmen remaining). Hit starfighters are immediately lost.  \par \b It's Away!:\b0  Draw two destiny. \par \b Pull Up!:\b0  All starfighters now move to Death Star system (for free). If (total destiny +X +Y -Z) > 15, Death Star is "blown away."  \par X = ability of lead pilot or 3 if Targeting Computer is present. \par Y = total sites at largest Rebel Base (Yavin 4 or Hoth). \par Z = highest ability of TIE pilots in trench. \par *Your proton torpedoes are immune to Overload.
cards.name: Attack Run

cards.gametext: Once per game, target one non-unique starfighter on table. Draw destiny. If destiny < X, retrieve X Force, where X = number of copies of that card you have on table. (Immune to Sense.) OR Take one non-unique starfighter into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
cards.lore: "Red 10 standing by." "Red 7 standing by." "Red 3 standing by." "Red 6 standing by." "Red 9 standing by." "Red 2 standing by." "Red 11 standing by." "Red 5 standing by."
cards.name: All Wings Report In

cards.gametext: If Luke and Leia are in a battle together, you may add two battle destiny. OR Cancel Imperial Barrier or Wrong Turn or Retract The Bridge.
cards.lore: Luke and Leia escaped to an unused portion of the Death Star, evading security checkpoints. At a retracted bridge, they swung across on a grappling line through enemy fire.
cards.name: Skywalkers

cards.gametext: *\b Deploy\b0  on a Dagobah site. *\b Target\b0  a mentor on Dagobah and an apprentice who has completed Jedi Test #4. *\b Attempt\b0  when apprentice is present at the beginning of your control phase. Turn apprentice upside down (cannot move and power = 0). At the end of your next turn, turn apprentice right side up (restored): *\b Place\b0  on apprentice. Immune to attrition < 4. Reveal the top two cards of your Reserve Deck and place one upside down on apprentice. Whenever you are about to draw a card for destiny, you may instead use the upside-down card (which remains on apprentice for re-use).
cards.name: It Is The Future You See

cards.dark_side_text: If you control, Force drain -1 here.
cards.gametext: Leia is deploy -2 here   If you control, Force drain -1 here.
cards.name: Cloud City: Guest Quarters

cards.dark_side_text: If you occupy, opponent's Yoda's Hut game text is canceled.
cards.gametext: If Yoda here, once per turn, may subtract 2 from attrition against you at another location.   If you occupy, opponent's Yoda's Hut game text is canceled.
cards.light_side_text: If Yoda here, once per turn, may subtract 2 from attrition against you at another location.
cards.name: Dagobah: Yoda's Hut

cards.dark_side_text: "Trench Rules" in effect, your weapons fire free and Turbolaser Battery may deploy here.
cards.gametext: "Trench Rules" in effect and each of your starfighters is maneuver -2 here.   "Trench Rules" in effect, your weapons fire free and Turbolaser Battery may deploy here.
cards.light_side_text: "Trench Rules" in effect and each of your starfighters is maneuver -2 here.
cards.name: Death Star: Trench

cards.gametext: Your starships deploy -2 here and are hyperspeed +2 when moving to or from here. Neither player may Force drain here.
cards.light_side_text: Your starships deploy -2 here and are hyperspeed +2 when moving to or from here. Neither player may Force drain here.
cards.name: Rendezvous Point

cards.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 1 astromech. Immune to attrition < 3 if Wedge piloting.
cards.lore: Wedge's X-wing at Battle of Yavin. Wedge had to nurse the fighter home after a hit in the Death Star trench destroyed its micro-maneuvering controls.
cards.name: Red 2

cards.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 1 astromech. Immune to attrition < 4 if Luke piloting. When firing in an Attack Run, adds 1 to total.
cards.lore: Luke's Incom T-65 X-wing at the Battle of Yavin. Instrumentation similarities between Red 5 and the T-16 skyhopper allowed Luke to play a pivotal role in the conflict.
cards.name: Red 5

cards.gametext: May add 4 pilots and 4 passengers. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Your medical droids and Bacta Tank 'patients' may deploy aboard for free.
cards.lore: Nebulon-B frigate used as a mobile medical facility. Extra cargo space and weapon batteries have been modified to allow for more armor and more recovery areas.
cards.name: Redemption

cards.gametext: May deploy -3 as a 'react.' May add 3 pilots, 4 passengers and 1 vehicle. Has ship-docking ability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2.
cards.lore: Has conducted several successful ambushes on Imperial convoys. Veteran crew. Has a reputation for arriving when least expected.
cards.name: Spiral

cards.gametext: May be deployed even without presence or Force icons. May add 3 pilots and 4 passengers. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2.
cards.lore: Royal House of Alderaan consular ship. Used by Princess Leia for Imperial Senate business (and secret Rebel espionage). Captured by the \ul Devastator\ul0  over Tatooine.
cards.name: Tantive IV

cards.gametext: May add 2 pilots or passengers. Immune to attrition < 3 if Luke piloting. May move as a 'react' only to Hoth sites.
cards.lore: Designated Rogue Leader. Led snowspeeder attack during the Battle of Hoth. \b Enclosed\b0. Piloted by Commander Skywalker, with Dack Ralter as tailgunner.
cards.name: Rogue 1

cards.gametext: May add 2 pilots or passengers. Immune to attrition < 3 if Wedge piloting. May move as a 'react' only to Hoth sites.
cards.lore: \b Enclosed\b0. Piloted by Commander Wedge Antilles. Successful walker tripper. Abandoned during the Rebel evacuation of Echo Base.
cards.name: Rogue 3

cards.gametext: Deploy on your Skywalker of ability > 3. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
cards.lore: Constructed by Anakin Skywalker. Kept by Obi-Wan Kenobi until given to Luke.
cards.name: Anakin's Lightsaber

cards.gametext: Deploy on Obi-Wan. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
cards.lore: "An elegant weapon for a more civilized time." Miniaturized power cell. Uses rare crystals to focus the lightblade. This lightsaber was personally built by Obi-Wan.
cards.name: Obi-Wan's Lightsaber

cards.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting \ul Slave I\ul0, also adds 2 to maneuver and may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. When escorting a captive, captive is forfeit +5. May 'fly' (landspeed = 3). Immune to attrition < 3.
cards.lore: Feared \b bounty hunter\b0. Collected bounties on Solo from both the Empire and Jabba the Hutt. Took exquisite pleasure in using Solo's friend to capture him.
cards.name: Boba Fett

cards.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (3 if piloting \ul Falcon\ul0). Power +1 for every Cloud City location you control. When playing Sabacc, may add 1 to or subtract 1 from your total.
cards.lore: \b Gambler\b0. Scoundrel. Former owner of the \ul Millennium Falcon\ul0. Despite a notorious past, has become a successful chief administrator of a Tibanna gas mining facility.
cards.name: Lando Calrissian

cards.gametext: Deploys only on Cloud City. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When playing Sabacc, may subtract 1 from or add 1 to your total. If present at a site, can be replaced by opponent with any Light Side Lando.
cards.lore: Scoundrel and \b gambler\b0. Petty administrator of a small Tibanna gas mining operation. Easily coerced. Has problems of his own. Had dealings with the Tonnika sisters - twice.
cards.name: Lando Calrissian

cards.dark_side_text: X = parsec of current position. Deploys only at Parsec 0. Hyperspeed = 1. Immune to Revolution. If this is your starting location, Light Side goes first in game.
cards.gametext: X = parsec of current position. Deploys only at Parsec 0. Hyperspeed = 1. Immune to Revolution. If this is your starting location, Light Side goes first in game.
cards.name: Death Star

cards.gametext: Deploys only as a 'react' to a Cloud City site or to where your Lando is present. When present at a Scomp link, power +2 and opponent's total power is -2 at same site. Your Cloud City troopers deploy free and are power +1 at same Cloud City site.
cards.lore: Former criminal. Fitted with a cybernetic device. Now repays his debt to society by ensuring the smooth running of Cloud City. Becomes disoriented when not with a computer.
cards.name: Lobot

cards.gametext: Deploys only on Cloud City. Power +2 when present at a Scomp Link. If present at a site, can be replaced by opponent with any Light Side Lobot. While present on Cloud City with your Lando, prevents replacement of Lobot and Lando.
cards.lore: Son of a traveling slaver. Helps run Cloud City with Administrator Lando Calrissian. Speech capability worn away by constant cyborg neural connection.
cards.name: Lobot

cards.dark_side_text: If you control, opponent's Downtown Plaza game text is canceled.
cards.gametext: Once during each of your control phases, may use 1 Force to retrieve one Cloud City location   If you control, opponent's Downtown Plaza game text is canceled.
cards.light_side_text: Once during each of your control phases, may use 1 Force to retrieve one Cloud City location.
cards.name: Cloud City: Downtown Plaza

cards.dark_side_text: X = parsec of current position (starts at 0). Immune to Revolution. You may move Death Star (hyperspeed = 1).
cards.gametext: Deploy if Death Star Plans completed and Death Star system not on table. If "blown away," Dark Side loses +8 Force.   X = parsec of current position (starts at 0). Immune to Revolution. You may move Death Star (hyperspeed = 1).
cards.light_side_text: Deploy if Death Star Plans completed and Death Star system not on table. If "blown away," Dark Side loses +8 Force.
cards.name: Death Star

cards.gametext: When in battle, adds 1 to each of your battle destiny draws. Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots (or 4 to power and 3 to maneuver if Vader's Custom TIE). Immune to attrition < 5.
cards.lore: Dark Lord of the Sith. Servant of Emperor. Encased in armor with cybernetic life support. Student of Obi-Wan Kenobi. Was the best starpilot in the galaxy. Cunning warrior.
cards.name: Darth Vader

cards.gametext: While Luke is not on Tatooine your total Force generation is +1. Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Red 5, also adds 2 to maneuver. Immune to attrition < 3.
cards.lore: Son of Anakin Skywalker. Student of Obi-Wan Kenobi. Honed piloting skills while bullseyeing womp rats in Beggar's Canyon aboard T-16 skyhopper.
cards.name: Luke Skywalker
